text:
West Sulawesi () is a province of Indonesia. It is on Sulawesi island. Its capital is Mamuju. The population was 1,158,651 in the 2010 Census. In 2014, the government reported the population as 1,284,620. The area of the province is 16,796.19 km2. The province was established in 2004. It separated from South Sulawesi.
Economy.
Main industries in the province are mining, agriculture and fishing.
Demographics.
The population in the 2010 census was 1,158,651. 171,356 people live below the poverty line of Indonesia.
